snippet: The number of people without health insurance dropped by 15.8 million, or one-third, since 2013, as major provisions of the Affordable Care Act took effect, the administration said.
abstract: National Center for Health Statistics reports that 29 million people lacked health insurance in first quarter of 2015, down seven million from 2014 average; reports that number of uninsured has fallen by 15.8 million, or one-third, since 2013.
lead_paragraph: The number of people without health insurance dropped by 15.8 million, or one-third, since 2013, as major provisions of the Affordable Care Act took effect, the administration said.

headline.main: Number of Uninsured Has Declined by 15 Million Since 2013, Administration Says
headline.print_headline: Number of Uninsured Has Declined by 15 Million Since 2013, Administration Says

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
